body:
@rafaelfranca Yep. I firstly thought so, but in this case it's OK to just remove because
* it's namespaced as ActiveSupport internal
* and there's no code using this class outside of Rails, so far as I grepped

OTOH there's another useless error class named `MissingSourceFile` https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/load_error.rb#L25
I actually pushed another commit removing this https://github.com/amatsuda/rails/commit/4d0114eb9d4f06f461e786a44c5923e6e7dd39c9 (I'll make another PR for this soon, if you think it's worthy), but in this case I left the alias because it's declared as a top-level constant.
